<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Immediate operand kind.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It helps to identify the location of an offending operand after an error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that regular literals and mandatory literals (KImm) must be handled</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// differently. When looking for an offending operand, we should usually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ignore mandatory literals because they are part of the instruction and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cannot be changed. Report location of mandatory operands only for VOPD,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when both OpX and OpY have a KImm and there are no other literals.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3302"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if this is an operand modifier or an opcode modifier</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which may look like an expression but it is not. We should</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// avoid parsing these modifiers as expressions. Currently</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3305"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// recognized sequences are:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3306"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   |...|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3307"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   abs(...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3308"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   neg(...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3309"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   sext(...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3310"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   -reg</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3311"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   -|...|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   -abs(...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3313"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   name:...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3314"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3326"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3327"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if the current token is an SP3 &#39;neg&#39; modifier.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3328"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently this modifier is allowed in the following context:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3329"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3330"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 Before a register, e.g. &quot;-v0&quot;, &quot;-v&#91;...&#93;&quot; or &quot;-&#91;v0,v1&#93;&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3331"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 Before an &#39;abs&#39; modifier: -abs(...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3332"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3 Before an SP3 &#39;abs&#39; modifier: -|...|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3333"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3334"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In all other cases &quot;-&quot; is handled as a part</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3335"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of an expression that follows the sign.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note: When &quot;-&quot; is followed by an integer literal,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3338"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this is interpreted as integer negation rather</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// than a floating-point NEG modifier applied to N.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3340"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Beside being contr-intuitive, such use of floating-point</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3341"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NEG modifier would have resulted in different meaning</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3342"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of integer literals used with VOP1/2/C and VOP3,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for example:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3344"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    v&#95;exp&#95;f32&#95;e32 v5, -1 // VOP1: src0 = 4294967295</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3345"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    v&#95;exp&#95;f32&#95;e64 v5, -1 // VOP3: src0 = 2147483649</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3346"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Negative fp literals with preceding &quot;-&quot; are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3347"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// handled likewise for uniformity</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3348"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3349"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3350" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-amdgpuasmparser-cpp-/amdgpuasmparser/#aec6bf39ecab2cbc57a7ef96190d6019e"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-amdgpuasmparser-cpp-/amdgpuasmparser/#aec6bf39ecab2cbc57a7ef96190d6019e">AMDGPUAsmParser::parseSP3NegModifier</a>() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3351"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3352"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/asmtoken">AsmToken</a> NextToken&#91;2&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3353"><Highlight kind="normal">  peekTokens(NextToken);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3354"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
